snippet: The party’s Central Committee endorsed the expulsion of Bo Xilai, who had been a contender for one of the party’s highest positions until his spectacular fall this year.
abstract: Top leaders in China's Communist Party approve a raft of measures that pave the way for a once-in-a-decade leadership transition; decisions include the expulsion of disgraced politician Bo Xilai from the party and the promotion of two generals, Fan Changlong and Xu Qiliang, to vice chairmen of the Central Military Commission.
lead_paragraph: The party’s Central Committee endorsed the expulsion of Bo Xilai, who had been a contender for one of the party’s highest positions until his spectacular fall this year.

headline.seo: China’s Communist Party Expels Bo Xilai
headline.main: China Party Endorses Expulsion in Scandal
headline.print_headline: China Party Endorses Expulsion In Scandal
